pingball.simulation

Class Wall

  • java.lang.Object
    • pingball.simulation.GameObject
      • pingball.simulation.Wall

  • public class Wall
extends GameObject
    A bounding wall of the board. Keep the side of it and the board that it is on in order to compute its coordinate. It also keep tracks on the board name that connects to it (if there is such board). Rep-Invariant: connected is false if and only if connectedboardname is null location must only be one of these: (-1,-1), (-1,board.height), (board.width,-1)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static class  Wall.Side
      The side of the board on which the wall is.

    • Method Detail

      • getLocation

        public final GridLocation getLocation()
        Returns the grid location of the top left corner of the wall.
        Specified by:
        getLocation in class GameObject
        Returns:
        The grid location.

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String name)
        Connect the wall to a particular board. Balls hitting the wall will pass through this wall into the board.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the board to which this wall is connected.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnect the wall from any boards. Balls hitting the wall will now reflect from the wall.

      • evolve

        public void evolve(double time)
        Evolve the wall for a specified period of time. For a wall, this does nothing.
        Overrides:
        evolve in class GameObject
        Parameters:
        time - The time period to evolve the object for.

      • collide

        public void collide(Ball ball,
           Collidable collidable)
        Collide a ball with a particular collidable in the wall. If the wall is connected to another board, the ball passes through the wall into the other board and is removed from this board. If the wall is not connected, the ball is reflected from the wall.
        Overrides:
        collide in class GameObject
        Parameters:
        ball - The ball that collides
        collidable - The collidable with which the ball collides

      • gridRepresentation

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> gridRepresentation()
        Returns a list of strings for the string representation of the square bumper. Grid representation of a unit length of the wall is "." For a horizontal wall, we have this repeated width number of times in one string. For a vertical wall, we have height number of such "." in the list.
        Specified by:
        gridRepresentation in class GameObject
        Returns:
        the grid representation
